Posts.Content: mssuzi01 wrote: Hi....I was diagnosed in November of 2006.  My sentinal node biopsy failed so they had to remove my lymph nodes in January of 2007.  Anyway, thank god none were positive but then my arm swelled and I started seeing someone to help me massage it out.  They got the fluid out and we got a sleave made before I started radiation.  I really had a hard time with the second surgery (to remove lymph nodes) getting my arm moving and the pain....it was pretty bad.  But I got it all moving and under control.  But here I am hitting my 2 year mark of being diagnosed and I am worse than I was a year ago.  On my shoulder blade, I have an area I can't reach with my hand, it seems to be right in the middle of the shoulder blade that hurts.  The skin started being sensative 3 to 4 weeks ago...I thought ok when I don't feel good my skin hurts.  But it just has gotten worse.  My clothes rub and its uncomfortable.  Then I sit back and my shoulder touches anything I about jump out of my seat.  Has anyone experienced this???  I feel like I am losing my mind but I think it has to do with everything because I am still very sensative along under my arm and ribs.  And it seems to kinda be tied into it.  I wear my sleave and for the most part have my swelling under control.  Except in my pointer finger...the pain in that joint is bad sometimes I can't move it.  and it looks a little bigger than normal.  Some pain in the shoulder area on top when I use it alot or when I am not suppose to (like lifting a small child).  I went in to the docs and they sent me to physical therapy who now has me rubbing the area with a towel.  I can't reach so its a hassle to try to rub it 3 times a day like that.  But thru all my ramblings my question is this:  Do others feel this weird sensation???  Is it normal???  I don't know but its sure annoying and I can see where it could cause depression...you're not the same after everything but a constant reminder 24/7 with the pain is almost too much sometimes.  So what do you do???  Ok, thank you for any responses...I am totally at a loss.  Take care Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question mssuzi01 inspiewriter
